name: contingent
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a group of people representing an organization or country, or a part of a military force: The French contingent certainly made their presence known at this year's conference. a large contingent of voluntary soldiers

Groups of people
contingent on/upon something
depending on something else in the future in order to happen: Outdoor activities are, as ever, contingent on the weather.

contingent noun [C]
(GROUP)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a group of people representing an organization or country, or a part of a military force: The conservative contingent walked out of the convention when their plan was rejected.
contingent adjective
(DEPENDING)
depending on or influenced by something else: Buying the new house was contingent on selling the old one.
Add to word list
Add to word list
depending on something else in the future in order to happen: contingent on/upon sth The contract is contingent on approval by the Board of Trustees.
